title: Is supporting larger client window size in the pipeline?
body:
I think it would be really helpful to have the client resize appropriately when being stretched to a larger window size. My user experience would be much more enjoyable if I can immerse more with the client by having it being full-screen. Also some text can feel small or hard to read. I play on my 1920x1080p monitor and I love using other games clients that have full screen (usually with some in engine connection with the client like in DotA 2). I understand that the tech is not built that way with League of Legends, but non the less it would still be cool if there was some amount of support for that larger window experience. 

What does Riot think about this?
What does everyone else think about this?

Thanks!

replies.body:
It's actually been added.  If you press Ctrl and +, the client expands to 1920x1080.

I will say, some icons look a tad blurry (namely the Play icon and animation), but it's an improvement.
The only other thing that I have seen turn blurry is the Hextech Crafting icons, like the chests. But being able to full screen the client is one of the coolest features ever.
Full screen is not in the road map. Resizing for bigger screens/resolutions is being worked on right now.
Sad to hear that, League is basically the only program I have ever seen that doesn't have a full screen option.
It would be nice to at least have the option but I don't know if people would do it since queues exist and usually people multitask while that's happening

Playing at 1920x1080 and zooming gives technical fullscreen as Windows hides taskbar when a window fits all screen.

And I love it, I hope you can tweak your resizing so we can have it in other resolutions and not just in the lucky 1080.
